About the job
About Wells Fargo
Wells Fargo & Company (NYSE: WFC) is a leading global financial services company headquartered in San Francisco (United States). Wells Fargo has offices in over 20 countries and territories. Our business outside of the U.S. mostly focuses on providing banking services for large corporate, government and financial institution clients. We have worldwide expertise and services to help our customers improve earnings, manage risk, and develop opportunities in the global marketplace. Our global reach offers many opportunities for you to develop a career with Wells Fargo. Join our diverse and inclusive team where you will feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience. We are looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.
Market Job Description

About Wells Fargo in India & Philippines

Wells Fargo in India & Philippines enables global talent capabilities for Wells Fargo Bank NA., by supporting business lines and staff functions across Technology, Operations, Risk, Audit, Process Excellence, Automation and Product, Analytics and Modeling. We are operating in Hyderabad, Bengaluru, Chennai & Manila locations.

Department Overview

Consumer and Small Business Banking (CSBB) provides financial services to 21 million retail bank households and three million small business customers through approximately 4,500 retail branches, 17 customer service centers, and approximately 13,000 ATMs in 36 states and the District of Columbia. We serve and help individuals and families in many aspects of their lives, helping them buy homes, open first bank and savings accounts, buy cars to get to and from work or school, and start or grow small businesses. CSBB is focused on innovating and transforming with the customer at the center, better enabling customers to engage with us how, when, and wherever they choose. As an industry leader in many consumer and small business areas - including retail deposits, debit card transaction and purchase volume, and small business lending - our primary goal is delivering for our customers.

The Consumer Data and Engagement Platform (CDEP)

The CDEP group works across the Consumer & Small Business Banking (CSBB), Consumer Lending, and Wealth and Investment Management lines of business to develop coordinated strategies for growth in each of Wells Fargo's customer segments. The team is responsible for designing seamless, engaging customer experiences across products and channels, and building the next-generation digital, data and analytics, and functional capabilities required to deliver toward these objectives. The Consumer Data Products function within CDEP aims to build a strong, centralized ecosystem to support the data needs of the consumer LOBs. This includes the build out of a common data platform (Consumer Analytics Platform, a.k.a. CAP), utilities (e.g., eligibility, transactional, etc.) and analytical capabilities to enable business priorities/use cases.

About This Role

Wells Fargo is seeking a Senior Data Management in Consumer Data and Engagement Platforms as part of Consumer and Small Business Banking. The Senior Data Management will be responsible for supporting the Head of Customer Information Management to plan and deliver the Analytics features and functions to meet prioritized enterprise objectives. The Senior Data Management will work with stakeholders from across multiple Wells Fargo lines of businesses and functions to manage the analytics roadmap and align it to business needs. The candidate will conduct value-based intake and prioritization across requests, bring subject matter expertise on current and emerging customer domain and technology trends to offer strategic solutions to plan and deliver Analytical capabilities that drive business value. Learn more about the career areas and lines of business at wellsfargojobs.com

To be successful in this role, you will need to:
Demonstrate data Analytics and technology thought leadership.
Assist with Analytics roadmap development to meet business needs.
Identify and recommend analysis of data quality or integrity issues.
Evaluate data quality metrics and data quality audits to benchmark the state of data quality.
Adhere to data governance standards and procedures.
Assess data security requirements for new and existing data sources.
Identify new data sources and develop recommendations for assessing the quality of new data.
Leads complex enterprise-wide programs and collaborates on strategic initiatives for data governance, data quality and metadata activities.
May act as a relationship manager for a line of business.
Required Qualifications, International:
7+ years of Data Management, Business Analysis, Analytics, Project Management experience, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education.
3+ years of experience with Metadata/Data dictionaries management including technical/business content and data lineage, Data Quality Assessments
Significant Agile methodology experience
Strong SQL skills and ability to query data a plus
Reporting/ Dashboarding tool - Tableau / Power BI
Proven ability to work within a data and analytics team
Desired Qualifications:
Proven ability to work within a data and analytics team
Strong interpersonal and communication skills
Experience within the customer data sub-domain
Prior exposure to data governance documentation and standards
Financial Services experience is strongly preferred
Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
Advanced Microsoft Office (Outlook, Teams, Excel, PowerPoint, Word), Visio, Microsoft Project, and SharePoint
We Value Diversity

At Wells Fargo, we believe in diversity, equity and inclusion in the workplace; accordingly, we welcome applications for employment from all qualified candidates, regardless of race, color, gender, national origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, individuals with disabilities, pregnancy, marital status, status as a protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable law.

Employees support our focus on building strong customer relationships balanced with a strong risk mitigating and compliance-driven culture which firmly establishes those disciplines as critical to the success of our customers and company. They are accountable for execution of all applicable risk programs (Credit, Market, Financial Crimes, Operational, Regulatory Compliance), which includes effectively following and adhering to applicable Wells Fargo policies and procedures, appropriately fulfilling risk and compliance obligations, timely and effective escalation and remediation of issues, and making sound risk decisions. There is emphasis on proactive monitoring, governance, risk identification and escalation, as well as making sound risk decisions commensurate with the business unit's risk appetite and all risk and compliance program requirements.

About the job
About the Company:

At AT&T, we’re connecting the world through the latest tech, top-of-the-line communications and the best in entertainment. Our groundbreaking digital solutions provide intuitive and integrated experiences for millions of customers across online, retail and care channels. Join our mission to deliver compelling communication and entertainment experiences to customers around the world as we continue to evolve as a technology-powered, human-centered organization. As part of our team, you’ll transform the way we deliver a seamless customer experience with digital at the center of all you do. In our world, digital is much larger than just an eCommerce channel, we are transforming all channels to digitally perform as one team to create a better customer experience.

About the Team:

Omni-channel Analytics Product Team is part of the Omni-channel Engineering team under Strategic Platform which aligns with the broader AT&T platform from a data collection standpoint and builds the next generation Data Collection, Data Pipeline, and Data Management solution that serves our business customers with ease of data access, consolidated information in a central place and build to new data models which make reporting easy, scalable, multidimensional to slice and dice, serving operational and business needs with near real-time reporting capabilities.

The job is responsible for understanding Analytics product features and collaborating with the product manager and the dev team members to break the work down into appropriate-size stories and dependencies groomed for development. Align with the design approach and development framework with the application architect to ensure analytics solutions meets the analytics platform architecture. Evaluate the design approach for issues, mitigation, the risk for scalability, performance, availability, and data loss.

Roles and Responsibilities:

Evaluates and documents data test cases for movement of medium to high complexity data between applications
Takes feedback from Product managers, APMs from Analytics Product team, additional stake holders to design/modify/execute data test cases
Adheres to and promotes the use of data governance standards.
Creates and sustains processes, tools, and on-going support structures and processes.
Passion for data and constantly driving for improving data quality.

Primary / Mandatory skills:

Overall Experience: - should have 4-6 years of experience in Data Quality Assurance using Web Applications/Native Experience.
Strong SQL Skills, Database knowledge, Deep analytics skills, Quality and testing processes, Data testing on browser, automation testing using tools like Selenium and skills to automate Data test cases and hands on experience in Web Analytics & BI tools like Adobe, Business Objects & Tableau.
Has good understanding on analytics platform/applications, including data warehouse and data marts and tools used for data validation.
Has good experience on various test tools from a data perspective and has background on automation testing to implement and execute on automation data testing.
Investigates and resolves data issues across platforms and applications, including discrepancies of definition, format, and function.
Works closely with Product Managers, Analytics Product Team, DBAs to develop deep understanding data sets being consumed within the omnichannel data space.
Need to understand the functionality of the application/web flows/native experiences and corelate it to the data being captured along with the functionality.
Responsible for constantly improving Data quality, Defect Management, giving perspective on Releases & Hot Fixes and provides insights and inputs to correctly make Go/No-Go discussions.
Should be very detailed oriented and think through all the scenarios that can potentially impact a use case and execute on those scenarios and see how data gets passed/broken or does not align with the functionality been show to the customer.
Should be a self-starter who thrives on making Development and delivery teams to fix issues and drive quality.
Experience working with defect management software such as JIRA/ADO, TDP, JIRA, AgileCraft, etc. is preferred
Experience with all phases of the software development life cycle, best practices and Agile Software Development.
Excellent communication skills and experience in collaborative environments
The desire to be continually learning about emerging technologies/industry trends

Shift falls typically between 5.30 PM to 2:30 AM India standard time. Occasionally may have to work long hours in situations when it is needed.

About the job

We are hiring a Sr. Data Analyst to join our Enterprise Analytics team. As a Senior Data Analyst, you will be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and presenting data to help drive business decisions. job_title: Senior Data Engineer (Data Quality Team) (Bangkok based, relocation provided)
job_description:
About the job
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodation, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ talents coming from 90+ different nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enabling our customers to experience the world

Get to Know Our Team

The Data department oversees all of Agoda’s data-related requirements. Our ultimate goal is to enable and increase the use of data in the company through creative approaches and the implementation of powerful resources such as operational and analytical databases, queue systems, BI tools, and data science technology. We hire the brightest minds from around the world to take on this challenge and equip them with the knowledge and tools that contribute to their personal growth and success while supporting our company’s culture of diversity and experimentation. The role the Data team plays at Agoda is critical as business users, product managers, engineers, and many others rely on us to empower their decision making. We are equally dedicated to our customers by improving their search experience with faster results and protecting them from any fraudulent activities. Data is interesting only when you have enough of it, and we have plenty. This is what drives up the challenge as part of the Data department, but also the reward.

Why Agoda Data Applications Team?

Our Data Engineering teams are at the intersection of business analytics, data warehousing and software engineering. Our job involves dealing with distributed systems, stream processing, computation and data governance at tens of PB Scale.

We focus on software engineering related to data replication, storage, centralized computation, and Data API’s. By providing our users with data products/tools, shared frameworks and data services, we enable our company to validate strategic decisions, make smarter choices, and react to the fast-changing world.

We are a small but passionate team with people from different nationalities working together on a single goal J

In this Role, you will get to

Lead the team technically in improving scalability, stability, accuracy, speed and efficiency of our existing Data systems
Build, administer and scale data processing pipelines
Be comfortable navigating the following technology stack: Scala, Spark, java, Golang, Python3, scripting (Bash/Python), Hadoop, SQL, S3 etc
Improve scalability, stability, accuracy, speed and efficiency of our existing data systems
Design, build, test and deploy new libraries, frameworks or full systems for our core systems while keeping to the highest standards of testing and code quality
Work with experienced engineers and product owners to identify and build tools to automate many large-scale data management / analysis tasks

What You’ll Need To Succeed

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science /Information Systems/Engineering/related field
At least 5 years of experience in Data engineering, familiar with large dataset
Expert level in Apache Spark
Expert level understanding of JVM and either Java or Scala, strong coding skill
Experience debugging and reasoning about production issues is desirable
A good understanding of data architecture principles preferred
Any other experience with Big Data technologies / tools
SQL experience
Analytical problem-solving capabilities & experience
Systems administration skills in Linux

It’s great if you have

Good understanding of Hadoop ecosystems
Experience working with Open-source products
Python/Shell scripting skills
Working in an agile environment using test driven methodologies

job_title: Research - Senior Data Analyst / Data Specialist
job_description:
About the job
Description

Wanted: dynamic and creative individuals ready to connect with a like-minded team. You’ll enjoy all the autonomy you need to help our clients make their digital infrastructure faster and more effective. Free reign for free spirits doesn’t mean you’ve got to go it alone. Over 1400 teammates from around the globe are eager to help you out when things get down to wire. Their expertise will put you on the winning path and keep you there. So get ready to kickstart your career with a team that’s connected – connected by freedom.

Description:

Senior Data Analyst / Data Specialist role within the ISG Provider Services team is expected work on various data management tasks. The Analyst is expected to collaborate with multiple teams within the larger team and help manage different internal databases working on cleaning, storing, and retrieving data.

The candidate is expected to have some exposure to ITO or BPO industry, exceptional organizational skills, English writing and speaking skills, strong data analysis and analytical skills. It would be a great add on if the candidate has some experience in performing secondary research.

Responsibilities:
Execute customized data runs from ISG’s proprietary databases to address specific internal & external client
Collaborate with other relevant teams to work on streamlining the data collection and management processes
Work on building a referable database using a standard template. Thoroughly understand the contracts given in the IT services domain and populate the database with the data points available in the contracts.
Thoroughly understand the underlying data, business implications and usage of data for research and consulting deliverables
Assist and develop excel models and frameworks on excel
Collaborate with other teams and work on data manipulation and database management tasks
Ability and desire to meet the deadlines and deliver results with minimum supervision
Time management skills and the ability to handle multiple projects with aggressive deadlines

Technical Skills Required:
4 to 7 years of experience with focus on data analysis and research preferably in IT and BPO industry
Comfortable with analyzing large data sets
Advanced MS-Excel skills including but not limited to pivots, power pivot, power query, dashboards, and advanced Excel formulas is must
Understanding of disciplined approach towards Data Visualization and Reporting with Excel and Power BI is must. Should have an edge over making DAX queries in Power BI desktop.
Hands-on web data scraping experience by using BeautifulSoup/Soupy in Python Environment is preferred
Ability to locate and procure information from unstructured documents
Ability to extract meaningful information and formulate a point of view based on extracted data, analyzing available data and filling gaps using appropriate statistical methods
Outstanding analytical, problem solving, and organizational skills
Supporting initiatives for data integrity and normalization
Excellent written and verbal skills
Skilled at working both independently and in a team environment
The ability to work a flexible schedule, collaborating with both US and European regions

At ISG, we don’t just accept difference — we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our clients, and our communities. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. ISG is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and we are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. The more diverse and inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

The duties and responsibilities described in this job description may not be a comprehensive list. Additional tasks may be assigned to the employee from time to time and/or the scope of the job may change as necessitated by business demands.

About the job
The Role: As a Software Developer with the Content Systems Development team, you will be responsible for developing & providing backend support across a variety of products within the Market Intelligence platform. Together, you will build scalable and robust solutions using AGILE development methodologies with a focus on high availability to end users.

The Location: Islamabad, Pakistan

The Team: Do you love to collaborate & provide solutions? This team comes together across eight different locations every single day to craft enterprise grade applications that serve a large customer base with growing demand and usage. You will use a wide range of technologies and cultivate a collaborative environment with other internal teams.

The Impact: We focus primarily developing, enhancing and delivering required pieces of information & functionality to internal & external clients in all client-facing applications. You will have a highly visible role where even small changes have very wide impact.

What’s in it for you?
Opportunities for innovation and learning new state of the art technologies
To work in pure agile & scrum methodology
Responsibilities
Ability to understand complex architecture & design
Deliver solutions within a multi-functional Agile team
Develop expertise in our proprietary enterprise software products
Set and maintain a level of excitement in using various technologies to develop, support, and iteratively deploy real enterprise level software
Achieve an understanding of customer environments and their use of the products
Adhere & apply software engineering practices and implement automation across all elements of solution delivery
Technical Leads will be expected to build solutions, architecture, algorithms, and designs which scale to the customer's enterprise/global requirements
Basic Qualifications

What we’re looking for:
Proven experience of application development experience with deep understanding of Design Patterns & Object-oriented programming.
Strong problem solving, analytical and communication skills.
Ability to analyze and resolve performance issues through various techniques including testing, debugging and profiling.
Strong OOAD & Service Oriented Architecture (SOA) knowledge.
Hands on development experience using C#, .Net 4.0/4.5, JAVA, WPF, Asp.Net, SQL server.
Strong understanding of Cloud enabled applications (Containers, Dockers etc.)
Exposure to Data Engineering & Big Data technologies like Hadoop, Spark/Scala, Nifi & ETL.
Familiarity with enabling DevOps on enterprise application suite, will be a plus.
Possess a true “roll up the sleeves and get it done” working approach; demonstrated success as a problem solver, operating as a client-focused self-starter.
Preferred Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering

About S&P Global MI

At S&P Global Market Intelligence, we know that not all information is important—some of it is vital. Accurate, deep and insightful. We integrate financial and industry data, research, and news into tools that help track performance, generate alpha, identify investment ideas, understand industry dynamics, perform valuation and assess credit risk. About the job
WPP is the transformation company. We use the power of creativity to build better futures for our people, planet, clients, and communities.

Working at WPP means being part of a global network of more than 109,000 accomplished people in 110 countries. WPP has headquarters in New York, London and Singapore and a corporate presence in major markets worldwide.

We create transformative ideas and outcomes for our clients through an integrated offer of communications, experience, commerce, and technology.

WPP and our award-winning agencies work with most of the world's biggest companies and organisations – from Ford, Unilever and P&G to Google, HSBC, and the UN. Our clients include 61 of the FTSE 100, 317 of the Fortune Global 500, all 30 of the Dow Jones 30 and 62 of the NASDAQ 100. WPP are the leader in the Bloomberg Gender Equality Index and 8th in the FTSE 100 rankings for Women on Boards.

WPP IT provides IT services for WPP, the world’s largest communications services group. As a creative transformation company, WPP is helping its clients transform the future through extraordinary work. WPP IT is an integral part of that journey and we are proud to provide technology for some of the world’s most creative brands.

Visit our LinkedIn page to see what we're up to!

Why we're hiring:

The cloud will deliver transformative value to WPP and its Operating Companies by creating outstanding services for customers that both delight and enhance the experience for clients and colleagues. The CloudHub is a new centralised cloud engineering, solution architecture and operations team that will simplify, secure and accelerate the use of cloud at WPP by creating fantastic products, making cloud easy and keeping everyone safe.

The Senior Azure Platform Engineer is a critical role for the success of CloudHub Engineering. The role's primary focus will be to develop and own the building blocks of the Cloud Platform.

What you'll be doing:

The role is responsible for working with teams across the organisation to develop and build the re-usable or shared service components of the Cloud Platform

Design and maintain the building blocks of the cloud platform across Azure
Ensure that the platform remains secure via vulnerability scans and infrastructure backup updates
Drive the automation of infrastructure provisioning process
Select the appropriate Azure service based on data, compute, database, or security requirements
Oversees the build and operation of fast and scalable infrastructure deployment workflows
Helps architect and design the transformational journey into the cloud platform services
Includes the implementation and delivery of cloud products and services, configuration management, Infrastructure as Code template development, Testing and Troubleshooting
Deliver excellent customer outcomes through technical expertise
Build and maintain relationships across engineering

What you'll need:

Completed training in Azure Fundamentals
Understanding of cloud security policies and standards
Understanding of technical cloud infrastructure and configuration
Experience with infrastructure as code
Experience in Agile and DevOps methodologies
Experience with CI/CD and source code management tools
Demonstrated problem analysis and resolution skills
Understanding of Cloud Automation for standardisation and re-use
Design of native Cloud applications, Cloud application design patterns, and practices
Knowledge of Enterprise Architecture Frameworks and the Azure Well Architected framework
Designing, building, and operating global IT infrastructures
Experience in hosting cloud infrastructure and applications
A keen interest in new technologies and ability/willingness to research and self-study to keep technical skills relevant
Excellent problem resolution skills

Who you are:

You're open : We are inclusive and collaborative; we encourage the free exchange of ideas; we respect and celebrate diverse views. We are accepting: of new ideas, new partnerships, new ways of working.

You're optimistic : We believe in the power of creativity, technology and talent to create brighter futures or our people, our clients and our communities. We approach all that we do with conviction: to try the new and to seek the unexpected.

You're extraordinary: we are stronger together: through collaboration we achieve the amazing. We are creative leaders and pioneers of our industry; we provide extraordinary every day.

What we'll give you:

Passionate, inspired people – We promote a culture of people that do extraordinary work.

Scale and opportunity – We offer the opportunity to create, influence and complete projects at a scale that is unparalleled in the industry.

Challenging and stimulating work – Unique work and the opportunity to join a group of creative problem solvers. Are you up for the challenge?

WPP is an equal opportunity employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, age, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, military/veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, physical or mental disability. This team is responsible for creating data products using the latest technology, that create value by solving business requirements or risks, in coordination with Product Managers, Product Owners and Scrum Masters, also part of the Service Analytics organization. The data products are crucial for the Service business unit, a +10k people organization that relies on these data insights for data-focussed decision-making and performance management.

Enable a data focused Service organization through data analytics deployed via self-service tools, to make better decisions based on insights from data, to improve operational performance

Enable automation of analysis and reporting in BI tools for internal stakeholders

job_title: Software Engineer - Tanzu VMWare Greenplum -TDS Data Analytics (Greenplum)
job_description:
About the job
The Elevator Pitch: Why will you enjoy this new opportunity?

VMware Tanzu Greenplum is designed to run anywhere—on-premises, in public and private clouds, and in modern virtualized environments. Greenplum Database is an open-source, hardware-agnostic MPP database for analytics, based on PostgreSQL. It can scale towards a multi-petabyte level data workload without a single issue, and it allows access to a cluster of powerful servers that will work together within a single SQL interface where you can view all of the data scopes are::

Server/ Kernel R&D:: We are looking for engineers who want to make a lasting impact on our enterprise-grade database offerings for the next generation MPP open source database VMWare Greenplum. Greenplum Kernel R&D group is responsible for the database server components. Our team develops components ranging from distributed storage, memory and concurrency management, HA/replication, data protection and disaster recovery. As a developer on this team, you will be designing and building large-scale fault-tolerant distributed system components for the database, and you will continue to scale and optimize for performance to stay cutting edge.

Query Optimisation ::VMware Tanzu Greenplum Query Processing R&D group is focussed to make a lasting impact on our enterprise-grade database offerings for VMware Tanzu Greenplum. Query Processing sits at the core of VMware Tanzu Greenplum Database, and enables customers to efficiently scale and process petabytes of data. Our team has developed ORCA from scratch which is a modern top-down query optimizer based on cascades optimization framework and sits along with legacy postgres planner in Greenplum providing enhanced query optimization capabilities. We are bringing new and enhanced query optimization capabilities to the market and are looking for engineers with strong technical leadership to be part of a world class database query optimization team, participating in the design and development of a next generation features inside query optimization engine for the Massively Parallel Processing shared nothing open source database.

Success in the Role: What are the performance outcomes over the first 6-12 months you will work toward completing?

You have become familiar with the team’s technical domain and have begun using that knowledge to advise and influence cross-team collaborations.
You have become immersed in the team’s day to day operations, you are advising junior engineers on how to advance technical workstreams.
You have reviewed the team’s code base and have started a process of code reviews
You have reviewed and influenced the team’s architecture/design artifacts and decisions
You will lead the team in packaging the tools they built for production
You will lead the team in troubleshooting and mitigating high severity issues in production.

The Work: What type of work will you be doing? What assignments, requirements, or skills will you be performing on a regular basis?

"We are looking for engineers who want to make a lasting impact on our enterprise-grade database offerings for the next generation MPP open source database VMWare Greenplum.

Greenplum Kernel R&D group is responsible for the database server components. Our team develops components ranging from distributed storage, memory and concurrency management, HA/replication, data protection and disaster recovery. As a developer on this team, you will be designing and building large-scale fault-tolerant distributed system components for the database, and you will continue to scale and optimize for performance to stay cutting edge."

Desired Skills/ Experience
- 5+ Years of experience working on database internals (postgres/mysql, equivalent).
- Background in database internals in domains such as storage, replication, query execution, etc.
- Systems programming skills including multi-threading, memory modeling, IPC, network stack etc.
- Excellent C or C++ programming skills.
- Familiarity with development in a Linux environment.
- Strong CS fundamentals including data structures, algorithms
- Demonstrated mentor and technical team leader in a professional software team
- Ability to dive into a large polyglot codebase and work with other components as well.
- Experience debugging, diagnosing, and trouble-shooting complex production software.
- Skilled at drawing on your technical domain knowledge, design patterns, and experience to build maintainable software.
Other Qualifications
- BS/MS in Computer Science or equivalent.
- Contributed to an open-source project
- Experience in Postgres internals
- Understanding of transactions and consistency models
- Operations or Systems Administration experience, particularly on Linux
- Experience with Test Driven Development (TDD)

What is the leadership like for this role? What is the structure and culture of the team like?

We work as a distributed team in India, Beijing and the United States. Each team comprises Engineers, a Product Manager and an Engineering Manager. We value collaboration and start our days with daily stand ups where decisions are made to pair or work solo. Members often schedule knowledge sharing or technical review sessions on a regular basis. It is also important to us to make time to check in on the team’s overall well-being, this is done by having retro sessions to review the past week's events, regular 1:1s with your engineering manager and periodic team health checks.

VMware Tanzu Greenplum program is committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion. We are a learning organisation and believe that diverse teams are stronger and more effective at solving the complex problems we make simple for our customers. Empathy, diverse points of view, approaches, and skill sets bring us to the best solution faster, together.

Where is this role located?

Flexible: The role is considered flexible and will be a mix of working from a local VMware office and remote depending on your preferences and the arrangements determined with your future manager. You will be expected to live within a reasonable non-daily commute of the office.

What are the benefits and perks of working at VMware?

You and your loved ones will be supported with a competitive and comprehensive benefits package. Below are some highlights, or you can view the complete benefits package by visiting www.benefits.vmware.com.

Employee Stock Purchase Plan
Medical Coverage, Retirement, and Parental Leave Plans for All Family Types
Generous Time Off Programs
40 hours of paid time to volunteer in your community
Rethink's Neurodiversity program to support parents raising children with learning or behavior challenges, or developmental disabilities
Financial contributions to your ongoing development (conference participation, trainings, course work, etc.)
Wellness reimbursement and online fitness and wellbeing classes

Category : Engineering and Technology

Subcategory: Software Engineering

Experience: Manager and Professional

Full Time/ Part Time: Full Time

Posted Date: 2023-03-24

VMware Company Overview: At VMware, we believe that software has the power to unlock new opportunities for people and our planet. We look beyond the barriers of compromise to engineer new ways to make technologies work together seamlessly. Our cloud, mobility, and security software form a flexible, consistent digital foundation for securely delivering the apps, services and experiences that are transforming business innovation around the globe. About the job
Skill required: Data Maintenance - Clinical Data Management

Designation: Management Level - Analyst

Job Location: Bengaluru

Qualifications: BE/BSc/BTech/MCA

Years of Experience: 3 to 5 years

About Accenture

Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Technology and Operations services, and Accenture Song— all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. Our 699,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities.Visit us at www.accenture.com


What would you do?

You will be aligned with our Pharmaceuticals Processes vertical and help us with the processes to collect, monitor, research, assess and evaluate information on the adverse effects of medication with a view to identifying new information about hazards associated with medicines and consequently, prevent harm to patients. It also deals with the reviewing and resolving of discrepancies identified by the system or through manual checks as per guidelines. Employees under this span can also be responsible for a number of activities related to the design, development, and maintenance of Clinical Database objects. You will be working as a part of the Data Maintenance team which is responsible for the completeness & validity of the data in the clinical database. The team reviews and resolves discrepancies identified by the system or through manual checks as per guidelines, issues data clarification forms as and when required. You will have to perform discrepancy review & perform Self-Evident Corrections per DRP (as and when required). You will also solve for discrepancy management for SAE related discrepancies. The Clinical Data Management team focuses on the collection, integration, and availability of data at appropriate quality and cost. The team is responsible for performing data management activities including discrepancy review, query generation, and resolution. The team is also responsible for creating CRF Completion Guidelines (CCG) and SAE reconciliation guidelines. The role may require you to identify and raise protocol deviations in the database, perform edit check validation by creating test cases, write test scripts, and carry out database validation (UAT) against the specified CRF/ECRF. The role may also need expertise in managing clinical data management projects.

What are we looking for?


Elluminate Clinical Data Solution

Extract Transform & Load (ETL) Tools

SAS Clinical

SQL (Structured Query Language)

Adaptable and flexible

Ability to perform under pressure

Problem-solving skills

Roles And Responsibilities


In this role you are required to do analysis and solving of lower-complexity problems

Your day to day interaction is with peers within Accenture before updating supervisors

In this role you may have limited exposure with clients and/or Accenture management

You will be given moderate level instruction on daily work tasks and detailed instructions on new assignments

The decisions you make impact your own work and may impact the work of others

You will be an individual contributor as a part of a team, with a focused scope of work

Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts

BE/BSc/BTech/MCA

Sulekha’s growth is powered by its forward-looking innovation-driven structure, game-changing environment of high autonomy with accountability, and a start-up culture of participation, learning and experimentation. job_title: Senior Data Analyst (Bangkok Based, Relocation Provided)
job_description:
About the job
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Get to know our team:

The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda has deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and has built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.

Due to continued expansion, there are multiple analyst roles within the marketing team across different marketing channels. While the scope will vary depending on these channels, here are some examples:

Experimentation and optimizing campaign performance: Experiment with ads/campaign structures and bidding& pricing strategies on partners such as Google, Bing, TripAdvisor, Trivago, and other search engines. Adapt to new product features and roll out changes from successful tests.
Modeling: Analyze vast amounts of data generated by experiments, develop predictive models using data science techniques (e.g. understanding the impact on bookings from large-scale TV campaigns or demand elasticity from pricing optimization), and liaise with product teams on an implementation roadmap
Reporting, analysis, and insights: Building dashboards to track performance, derive insights, understand growth levers, and communicate recommendations via presentations to stakeholders

What you’ll Need to Succeed:

Experience with A/B testing and other testing metrics
Strong presentation and negotiation skills

About the job
Job Description

We are looking for Senior Data scientist to join our Data Analytics team (offices working in Hybrid model). This is an amazing opportunity to support the team for analysis of Real world data (RWD) by taking individual responsibility of assigned projects. The team consists of around 30 people and the reporting is to the Manager – Data Analytics.

Joining our team of Data analyst/Data scientist, you will support the team for analysis of Real-world data (RWD) by taking individual responsibility of assigned projects. As a member you will be conducting retrospective data analysis including data management and statistical programming as well as the development of RWD dashboards by translating the Methodology into complex algorithms in collaboration with Team.

Bachelor's/Master’s degree in computer engineering preferred
6+ Years’ experience in a Data Scientist role
Prior work experience in the field of advanced analytics preferably healthcare analytics, IT, consulting and/or business intelligence is preferred.
Strong problem-solving skills; ability to process complex information, break it into logical steps/tasks and present it clearly to a range of audiences
Strong on entrepreneurial drive; committed to team and personal development
Client service and operation mindset
Strong team player in a dynamic and changing environment; ability to work well with multi-disciplinary teams across continents/time zones
Strong oral and written communication skills

It would be great if you also had .

Experience working with large databases, data visualization tools, machine learning and statistics preferred
Knowledge of automation or AI is a plus
Working knowledge of Tableau, R, Rshiny is a plus

What will you be doing in this role?

You will be staffed on active client engagements focused on health care value with the ultimate goal of making healthcare better, more affordable and more accessible for billions of people around the world.

You will be working on Clarivate data and responsible for analyzing this data using data processing/querying tool like SQL, R or Python. You will collaborate across a broad portfolio of sophisticated commercial analytics projects within data analytics team. This role reports into the Manager – Data Analytics

In this role, you will deliver high-quality analytical outputs to help guide decisions on the business problems for our clients. You will use our proprietary data and analytical platform and will be actively engaged with front-line client teams involved in helping fortune 500 pharmaceutical/payer/Provider to solve their key business questions

Team members will typically use business intelligence, data visualization, query, analytic and statistical software to build solutions, perform analysis and interpret data. Data sources include medical

About The Team

We work with mid-size pharma companies in providing solutions to solve key business questions. We work on the RWD data to calculate Patient, payer, provider level metrics which helps the pharma companies to derive complex business decisions. Our bold mission is to help customers solve some of the world's most complex problems by providing actionable information and insights that reduce the time from new ideas to life-changing inventions in the areas of science and intellectual property. We help customers discover, protect and commercialize their inventions using our trusted subscription and technology-based solutions coupled with deep domain expertise.

Hours of Work

This is a full-time position with Clarivate. We work in 12-9PM IST timings.

At Clarivate, we are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all persons with respect to hiring, compensation, promotion, training and other terms, conditions and privileges of employment. We comply with applicable laws and regulations governing non-discrimination in all locations.

About the job
What We Offer

As part of the process excellence team the Senior Business & Data Analyst will support key Global Project Engineering (GPE) initiatives by delivering solutions for the visualization and assessment of GPE Performance Data.

As a senior member of this team, you will have data analysis and visualization experince, while also being familiar with the use of statistical techniques to implement the analysis in a meaningful ways. You will work closely with other data analysts from the regional GPE teams as well as those within other operational units to ensure consistency of data and representation of information.

Coordination of the GPE data approach will be a vital responsibility of this role. You will prepare datasets from multiple sources such as SAP, Excel, and proprietary tools to visualize information in graphs, charts, and dashboards, measuring business performance and status. You will help maintain the integrity of Dematic’s data, making sure the data repositories produce consistent, reusable data, while also ensuring maintenance is appropriate for future use and updating.

This is an exciting role where you'll interact with both technical data development and business execution leaders to ensure the metrics and information are clear and consistent, driving the growth of the function by developing less experienced team members and providing guidance over time.

Core Accountabilities
Leads the GPE data team through collaboration with regional resources
Ensure best practice and consistency across GPE date and dashboards
Drives consistency, improvements and evolution of the dashboard design and data analysis
Enables the GPE leadership team to make smart strategic decisions by utilizing the GPE performance data dashboards
Strives for continuous improvement of process and methods
Collaborates with other stakeholders to understand data sets in use
Takes part in the development of and manipulation of data lakes for GPE
Creates ETL processes and business rules for integrating application-level data
Ensures the data catalog and dictionary is maintained during the development process
Assist in internal software solutions that require the sharing or centralization of data
Supports and helps define data quality reports for data stewardship
Works with GPE Leaders to define scope and requirements for new reports and data analysis
Participate in change management activities within the execution team as appropriate
Leverage data from a variety of sources (Snowflake, SAP, Excel) to analyze business performance, identify areas of opportunity and provide actionable insights
Design, testing, implementation, and evaluation of business process changes to improve data quality and business outcomes
Designs and executes visualizations for measuring business performance
Take ownership for ensuring the GPE visualizations are accurate and up to date
Other duties as assigned.
Tasks And Qualifications

Qualifications and Requirements:

Essential
Degree level qualified in Statistics, Mathematics Computer Science or Economics
Experience in a similar role is desirable.
3-5+ years’ experience in business or data analytics
Programming languages, such as SQL and DAX
Familiarity with cloud-based data warehouse retrieval, such as Snowflake
Working knowledge of BI platforms such as Power BI, Tableau, Salesforce and SAP
Mastery level Excel skills, including Power Query
Travel approx. 10%
Personal Attributes
Demonstrates KION Leadership Competencies: Taking Responsibility; Embracing Change; Fostering Communication; Understanding Business and Customers; Delivering Solutions; Driving Results
The ability to analyze, model and interpret data
Strong analytical skills and high level of mathematical ability
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Strong cross-functional skills, transcending across global teams  Self-motivated, customer oriented, team player with ability to manage multiple projects with minimal supervision
The ability to creatively design data visualization dashboards to provide a a clear user experience
Competence in making timely, effective, principles-based decisions
Outstanding team building skills with the ability to improve interaction and efficiency as well as the ability to break down barriers / silos
Organizational and Quality Orientation
Ability to work under minimum supervision
Demonstrates a high passion and drive
Ambitious and willing to go the extra mile

About the job
Wells Fargo is looking for a highly motivated and collaborative person who can work with all levels of the organization, senior business and technology leaders, and product, operations, and finance managers.

About This Role

At Wells Fargo, we are looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. We are seeking candidates who embrace diversity, equity and inclusion in a workplace where everyone feels valued and inspired. Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.

The Strategy, Digital & Innovation (SDI) team forges the strategic direction of Wells Fargo, provides and manages our digital foundation and common capabilities, and transforms our business models to meet evolving customer needs and grow the company. The investments we are making will help the company create innovative digital banking experiences and make it easier for customers to achieve their financial goals.

The team you are joining is delivering analytical insights in support of Wells Fargo's Enterprise Payments Strategy. This is an opportunity to drive the future of Wells Fargo.

Wells Fargo is seeking a Senior to drive data and analytics initiatives in the Payments Analytics and Insights Team. The team is responsible for supporting Digital Product Managers and Executives plus relevant stakeholders from across the enterprise. The team will collaborate with stakeholders to develop meaningful analyses which drive actionable insights. The team will also need to influence data architecture and may support payments strategy and product development initiatives.

In This Role, You Will
Contribute to the development of project specifications with internal podmates (analyst, visualizer, lead) and jointly present solutions to stakeholders and users to gain alignment in advance of execution.
Develop queries and other programmatic logic to effectively source, aggregate and combine data in line with product / project initiatives.
Proactively manage risk including measures to minimize inaccuracy and clarify the meaning of data which is delivered.
Document development processes, key decisions made and any risks or open items.
Support transition of code to production environments.
Required Qualifications:
Highly collaborative and inclusive approach with proven track record of delivering acknowledged value.
4+ years of Data Management, Business Analysis, Analytics, Project Management experience, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education.
2+ years of SQL experience.
Must-have skills: SQL (Expert), Teradata/any other RDBMS, experience in creating DQs/Controls and with trend/variance analysis.
Desired Qualifications:
Knowledge of banking products.
Experience with master reference data such as Customer hierarchies, legal entities, and product taxonomies.
Knowledge and understanding of relational and no-SQL databases, structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data.
Knowledge and understanding of Big Data technologies (Data lake, cloud-based infrastructure), architectures that support real-time analytics; and flexible data models to support querying of unstructured data.
Good-to-have skills: GCP, BigQuery, Azure Synapse Analytics, Python, Hadoop, Data Lakes.
We Value Diversity

At Wells Fargo, we believe in diversity, equity and inclusion in the workplace; accordingly, we welcome applications for employment from all qualified candidates, regardless of race, color, gender, national origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, individuals with disabilities, pregnancy, marital status, status as a protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable law.

Employees support our focus on building strong customer relationships balanced with a strong risk mitigating and compliance-driven culture which firmly establishes those disciplines as critical to the success of our customers and company. They are accountable for execution of all applicable risk programs (Credit, Market, Financial Crimes, Operational, Regulatory Compliance), which includes effectively following and adhering to applicable Wells Fargo policies and procedures, appropriately fulfilling risk and compliance obligations, timely and effective escalation and remediation of issues, and making sound risk decisions. There is emphasis on proactive monitoring, governance, risk identification and escalation, as well as making sound risk decisions commensurate with the business unit's risk appetite and all risk and compliance program requirements.

Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available upon request in connection with the recruitment process.

About the job
S&P Global Market Intelligence

The Role: Lead Data Analyst

Grade (relevant for internal applicants only): 8

The Location: Gurgaon (Additional locations – Ahmedabad, Hyderabad, Islamabad)

The Team

Transactions Data Management team encompasses M&A, Offerings, Spin-off, Buyback and Bankruptcy transactions, and is responsible for supporting variety of product initiatives involving data ingestion and data flow across Capital IQ, Capital IQ Pro and 451 Research products. The team deals in management of data & procedures, along with running multiple checks on the database for various metrics. The team is also involved in resolving client issues, which are escalated from time to time.

The Impact
Majority of the data is collected in-house and is moved to various products through variety of delivery mechanisms. Transaction’s data forms a critical part of client workflows, especially Investment Banking clients.
Team is also currently ingesting vendor data, which in addition to self-sourced data gives immense value add to the clients.
In addition to driving variety of initiatives around building Capital IQ Pro, team is closely involved in supporting Xpressfeed products, which hold potential cross sales opportunities.
What’s In It For You

Working with the group with Global footprint & opportunity to interact & collaborate extensively without boundaries with different stakeholders across Product, Client Ops, Data Operations, Technology teams and also across departments & domains. Being a part of Group driven by principles and challenging roles provides multiple paths for growth and pool of opportunities to learn and move forward.

Responsibilities
Assist on Offerings, Rounds of Fundings and Bankruptcy transactions project lifecycles
Support on translating business requirements into user stories, and groomings.
Understanding Transaction data structures and ensuing data flow across products is seamless.
Doing groundwork in gathering comprehensive business requirements to ensure there is least discovery of unknows during execution stage.
Act as SME, responsible for arriving at solutions to queries received around collection methodologies and client tasks.
Converting raw complex data into easy to understand and comprehendible information through data visualization.
Analyze and uncover inconsistencies in large amount of data (both in-house as well as supplied by third-party providers) by utilizing SQL knowledge and propose solutions to address them in S&P global products.
Basic Qualifications

What We’re Looking For:
Graduate or Post Graduate Degree
Hands on experience in writing and developing SQL Queries
Good understanding of S&P Products such as Capital IQ Pro, CapitalIQ, Excel Plug Ins, etc.
Experience in Data Mining, Analysis and Visualization SAFe Agile concepts and working with Agile Scrum teams Innovative and Effective
Problem-solving skills
Team player with an ability to work independently, manage multiple projects across segments and cultures, and adhere to all deadlines
Comfortable to work in evening shift and flexible hours
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Proficiency with Microsoft Office tools

Preferred Qualifications
Familiarity with Transactions (Offerings) dataset
Working knowledge of Visualization Tools (Tableau, Power BI etc.) is desirable

At S&P Global Market Intelligence, we know that not all information is important—some of it is vital. Accurate, deep and insightful. Investment professionals, government agencies, corporations and universities globally can gain the intelligence essential to making business and financial decisions with conviction.

About the job
Job Id: 23628413

Who We Are

With Citi’s Analytics & Information Management (AIM) group, you will do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative and respectful culture lets people grow and make a difference in one of the world’s leading Financial Services Organizations. The purpose of the group is to use Citi’s data assets to analyze information and create actionable intelligence for our business leaders. We value what makes you unique so that you have opportunity to shine. You also get the opportunity to work with the best minds and top leaders in the analytics space.

What The Role Is

The role of Office – Business Intelligence will be part of AIM CGW BI team based out of Chennai, India.

In this role, you will work alongside a highly talented team of analysts to build data and visualization solutions to identify key business initiatives, measure their success and support the organization’s client obsession goals by providing a superior client experience.

You will be responsible for the day to day running, upkeep and optimization of BI assets as well as cater to emerging business needs in a responsive manner.

You will be an SME in the group, support and mentor the team on technical solutioning and should be ready to lend your hand to juniors when needed.

Who You Are

Data Driven. A proven track record of enabling decision making and problem solving with data. Conceptual thinking skills must be complemented by a strong quantitative orientation and data driven approach.
Excellent Problem Solver. You are a critical thinker, able to ask right questions, make sense of a situation and come up with intelligence solution.
Strong Team Player. You build a trusted relationships with your team members. You are ready to offer unconditional assistance, will listen, share knowledge, and are always ready to provide support as needed.
Strong Communicator. You can communicate verbally and through written communication with clarity and can structure and present your work to senior leadership.
Clear Results Orientation. You display a keen focus on achieving both short and long-term goals and have experience driving and executing an agenda in a demanding and fast-paced environment, with an eye on risks & controls.
Innovative. You are always challenging yourself and your team to find better and faster ways of doing things.

What You Do

Data Exploration. Understand underlying data sources by dwelling into multiple platforms scattered across the organization. You do what it takes to gather information by connecting with people across business teams and technology.
Build Data Assets. You have a strong data design background and are capable of developing and building multi-dimensional data assets that captures abundant information about various line of business.
Process & Controls Orientation. You not only adhere to existing process and controls, also continuously monitor, question and identify potential process improvements. Create clear process documents, oversee across team and ensure they are always up to date.
Dashboarding and Visualization. You develop insightful, visually compelling and engaging dashboards that supports decision making and drive adoption.
Automation.
Flawless Execution. Manage and sequence delivery of reporting and data needs for yourself and juniors in the team. Become a SME in the team, understand business requirement and translate it into executable steps for the team members, support and troubleshoot issues, identify root cause, perform code review, share best practices, and be the final sign-off authority for team deliverables.

Qualifications

8+ years of work experience largely in the Business Intelligence & Data Management space
Minimum of 2 years of experience mentoring juniors and driving projects independently as senior analyst.
Strong understanding of Data modelling concepts and excellent SQL skills
Exposure to one or more programming languages Python, SAS
Hands-on experience using Python libraries, PySpark etc. for big data engineering
Working experience on Excel and BI Visualization tools like Tableau, Qlik etc. is a plus
Prior experience working in Customer experience, Operations, etc. is desirable

About the job
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodation, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ talents coming from 90+ different nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enabling our customers to experience the world

Get to Know Our Team

The Data department oversees all of Agoda’s data-related requirements. Our ultimate goal is to enable and increase the use of data in the company through creative approaches and the implementation of powerful resources such as operational and analytical databases, queue systems, BI tools, and data science technology. We hire the brightest minds from around the world to take on this challenge and equip them with the knowledge and tools that contribute to their personal growth and success while supporting our company’s culture of diversity and experimentation. The role the Data team plays at Agoda is critical as business users, product managers, engineers, and many others rely on us to empower their decision making. We are equally dedicated to our customers by improving their search experience with faster results and protecting them from any fraudulent activities. Data is interesting only when you have enough of it, and we have plenty. This is what drives up the challenge as part of the Data department, but also the reward.

Why Agoda Data Applications Team?

Our Data Engineering teams are at the intersection of business analytics, data warehousing and software engineering. Our job involves dealing with distributed systems, stream processing, computation and data governance at tens of PB Scale.

We focus on software engineering related to data replication, storage, centralized computation, and Data API’s. By providing our users with data products/tools, shared frameworks and data services, we enable our company to validate strategic decisions, make smarter choices, and react to the fast-changing world.

We are a small but passionate team with people from different nationalities working together on a single goal J

In this Role, you will get to

Lead the team technically in improving scalability, stability, accuracy, speed and efficiency of our existing Data systems
Build, administer and scale data processing pipelines
Be comfortable navigating the following technology stack: Scala, Spark, java, Golang, Python3, scripting (Bash/Python), Hadoop, SQL, S3 etc
Improve scalability, stability, accuracy, speed and efficiency of our existing data systems
Design, build, test and deploy new libraries, frameworks or full systems for our core systems while keeping to the highest standards of testing and code quality
Work with experienced engineers and product owners to identify and build tools to automate many large-scale data management / analysis tasks

What You’ll Need To Succeed

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science /Information Systems/Engineering/related field
At least 5 years of experience in Data engineering, familiar with large dataset
Expert level in Apache Spark
Expert level understanding of JVM and either Java or Scala, strong coding skill
Experience debugging and reasoning about production issues is desirable
A good understanding of data architecture principles preferred
Any other experience with Big Data technologies / tools
SQL experience
Analytical problem-solving capabilities & experience
Systems administration skills in Linux

It’s great if you have

Good understanding of Hadoop ecosystems
Experience working with Open-source products
Python/Shell scripting skills
Working in an agile environment using test driven methodologies

About the job
Job Summary
The Senior Associate, Global Operations will be an individual contributor as part of a new centralized team providing operational support to Global Mobility team members worldwide. You will also provide systems support for our newly implemented Global Mobility Management system, Topia. You will work under the general supervision of the Manager– Global Mobility Operations and liaise with individuals and teams across all levels in our wider Global Mobility Team. You will ideally be experienced in Global Mobility, with a strong data analysis and reporting background.
Your primary responsibilities but not limited to:
Global Mobility Tracking and Reporting
· Support Global Mobility teams with data collation, data clean-up and load/updates to the Global Mobility and HR systems
· Conduct periodic reviews of data quality and gaps in the Global Mobility and HR systems (in relation to Global Mobility data)
· Ensure data in system is updated for pre-payroll related activities for monthly payrolls, salary reviews, balance sheet updates etc.
· Understand global mobility needs and work with the technology vendor to advise end-users on how to best leverage the GM systems and functionality to achieve their goals
· Contribute to continuous improvement of GM systems data and workflows
· Prepare reports and dashboards in support of decision-making maintenance of controls
· Provide actionable insights into Global Mobility operations and costs
· Apply utmost care and take personal responsibility in maintaining confidentiality and security of data
Global Mobility systems update and maintenance
· Perform basic updates to systems configuration as a Super User
· Support the development and documentation of requirements for ongoing systems updates and enhancements
· Conduct SIT, UAT and other tests in support of new releases
· Lead training of users and develop user guides
· Understand business needs, gaps, and enhancements requirement to meet the needs to the users
· Support the development of the technology roadmap and manage priorities.
· Maintain User access to systems, and suggest appropriate data security controls.
Job Requirements
· Bachelor’s degree with 3 to 5 years of related experience in global mobility in a corporate or consulting environment, in particular focus on data, reporting and technology.
· Experience working with professional services, such as the Big-4 or Relocation Management, would be an advantage
· Strong English language verbal and written communication skills with Second language desirable
· Intermediate/ Advanced Microsoft Excel skills, with experience managing high volume of data and reports
· Basic/ Intermediate experience with MS VBA, MS Power BI, Robotic Process Automation, would be an advantage
· Experience working with Global Mobility Systems, such as Topia and AssignmentPro. Experience with HR systems such as SAP, Oracle etc. would be an advantage.
· Sound understanding of Global Data Protection Regulations (GDPR) and relevant data privacy/security requirements in relation to HR and Global Mobility data

About the job
We are seeking a talented Data Analyst enthusiast to join The Jar Team. If you are intellectually curious, if you eat/sleep/drink data and are committed to translating data to insights & insights to actionable work items, want new challenges daily and impact the lives of hundreds of thousands of users, this is the role for you!

What is Jar?

Jar is a savings app that helps its users save daily in the form of digital gold — we wish to help Indians rediscover the long-term benefits of habitual daily savings in an era where instant gratification is king.

Jar was founded by Nishchay AG, former director and founding member at mobility start-up Bounce, and Misbah Ashraf, founder of community-focused e-commerce platform Marsplay.

What does Jar do?

Jar is building a micro-wealth management platform, one step at a time — starting with micro savings, financial literacy, micro investments, and encouraging people to habituate the act of saving.

Responsibilities

Developing analysis and reporting capabilities. Assigning a numerical value to essential business functions so that business performance can be assessed and compared over periods of time
Monitoring performance and quality to identify improvements. Optimize existing services and systems, and ensure data quality and source of truth availability
Collaborating with other teams to find useful business insights
Supporting other teams in setting up success metrics for particular products/features
Working closely with the Project Manager to deliver on business requirements OTIF (ontime in full)
Working with both Web Analytics and Backend Data analytics
Quickly learning and using Bespoke & third party SaaS reporting tools with little documentation
Assisting in presenting demos and preparing materials for leadership

Requirements

2-4 years of experience with Python Data Analysis Packages(Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib, Scikit-Learn) is a must
Data Exploration and Visualisation with tools like Amplitude, Clevertap, MS Excel, Tableau, Power BI, etc
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organise, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Adept at queries, report writing, and presenting findings
A strong business sense with the ability to transform ambiguous business and product issues into well-scoped, impactful analysis
Fintech or B2C domain experience would be an added advantage
A desire to work in a fast-paced environment
Proactive communication

Why join Jar, you ask?

Jar is a diverse and inclusive workplace which embraces ideas and perspectives of all employees, and recognises their efforts and contributions regardless of gender or ethnicity. Our workspace also boasts a great blend of youth and experience, which helps us maintain a transparent culture with no micromanagement. We also have flexible working hours, and provide medical insurance to all employees.

About the job
This position is based in Bangalore, India.

Calix is leading a service provider transformation to deliver a differentiated subscriber experience around the Smart Home and Business, while monetizing their network using Role based Cloud Services, Telemetry, Analytics, Automation, and the deployment of Software Driven Adaptive networks.

As part of a high performing global engineering team, the right candidate will play a critical role in expanding the Calix Support Cloud solution. Calix Support Cloud empowers customer service organizations with Insights and real time data to maximize the support operations efficiency and deliver the best customer experiences.

Responsibilities and Duties:
Design, develop and maintain backend infrastructure, workflows, and services for enabling easy to use solutions for Customer Support organizations within service providers.
Develop solutions to support onboarding, partner integrations, managing, collecting, and analyzing data from large scale deployment of home networks and make them available as actionable insights to CSRs.
Work closely with Cloud product owners to understand, analyze product requirements, provide feedback, and deliver a complete solution.
Technical leadership of software design in meeting requirements of service stability, reliability, scalability, and security
Participate and drive technical discussions within engineering group in all phases of the SDLC: review requirements, produce design documents, participate in peer reviews, produce test plans, support QA team, provide internal training and support TAC team.
Support test strategy and automation in both end-to-end solution and functional testing.
Customer facing engineering role in debugging and resolving field issues.

Qualifications:
BS degree in Computer Science, engineering, or mathematics or equivalent experience.
5 -10 years of highly technical, hands-on software engineering experience
Independent and Self driven and works in a Team.
Strong, creative problem-solving skills and ability to abstract and share details to create meaningful articulation.
Ability to drive technical discussions across x-functional teams.
Proficient in design and implementation of microservices-based, API/Endpoint architectures
Strong background in designing and developing event-based / pub-sub workflows & data ingestion solutions. Proficiency and hands on experience with Kafka at scale (or similar) desired.
Experience in/Knowledge of protocols & technologies for managing home gateways (TR-069/TR-369, TR-98/TR-181), in-home services, monitoring and efficiently curating data from millions of IoT/WiFi devices a plus.
Good understanding of implementation and deployment of Cloud based solutions (preferably AWS)

Organized and goal-focused, ability to deliver in a fast-paced environment.
